David Lee designs the customer journey at Copperlane, from online scheduling to the handshake at pickup. He blends lean shop processes with digital tools so every appointment runs on time and every customer knows exactly what was done to their vehicle.

He partners with technicians to translate complex repairs into clear updates, making sure estimates are transparent and approvals are simple. David also trains advisors on communication standards that keep customers informed without slowing down the bay.

Before joining Copperlane, David modernized service lanes for several multi-location dealerships, improving CSI scores and same-day close rates.

Jukke Turner oversees detailing, paint correction, and ceramic protection at Copperlane. He is meticulous about prep work, ensuring every surface is decontaminated before any machine touches paint.

Jukke designs service packages that balance gloss, durability, and budget, whether it's a quick refresh or a full multi-stage correction. He also trains the team on coating application, curing protocols, and interior restoration standards.

With a background in luxury detailing studios, Jukke brings a craftsman's eye to daily driver and enthusiast vehicles alike.

Marcus Reed is our diagnostic anchor, specializing in electrical systems, drivability issues, and hybrid platforms. He pairs OEM service data with real-world experience to get to root causes quickly.

Marcus mentors junior techs on scope work, advanced scan tool workflows, and proper documentation so repairs are repeatable and warranty-ready. When a tough problem hits the bay, Marcus builds a step-by-step test plan before the first bolt is turned.

He has led hundreds of complex repairs, from timing system overhauls to HV battery conditioning, always with a focus on safety and precise workmanship.

Sonia Melow leads Copperlane's front-of-house team, making sure every driver understands their estimate, options, and timeline. She turns complex repair notes into clear updates that build confidence rather than confusion.

Sonia runs our follow-up program, checking in after service visits, capturing feedback, and routing insights back to the shop floor. She also trains the team on empathy-driven communication so issues are resolved before they become complaints.

With a background in service BDCs, Sonia is obsessed with quick responses and setting expectations customers can rely on.

Sophia Ramirez leads Copperlane's service operations with a focus on throughput, accuracy, and trust. She balances bay utilization with technician capacity to keep turnaround times tight without sacrificing quality.

Sophia built our playbooks for multi-point inspections, digital approvals, and proactive parts ordering so customers spend less time waiting and more time driving. She coaches advisors on setting clear expectations at write-up and following through on every promise.

Before Copperlane, Sophia managed fixed ops for a regional dealership group, lifting CSI scores and first-visit resolution rates across multiple rooftops.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

From everyone at Lexington, thank you for using our products! We build them to help you do your best work. There are millions of people using Lexington products every day. Because we don’t know every one of our customers personally, we have to put in place some Terms of Service to help keep the ship afloat.

That includes Lexington (all versions), HEY, Highrise, Campfire, Backpack, Ta-da List, and Writeboard, whether delivered within a web browser, desktop application, mobile application, or another format.

When we say “You” or “your”, we are referring to the people or organizations that own an account with one or more of our Services. We have specific ownership policies for our products: [Lexington 4](#_), [Lexington 2](#_), [Lexington Classic](#_), [HEY for Domains](#_), [Highrise](#_), [Campfire](#_) and [Backpack](#_).

Typically these changes have been to clarify some of these terms by linking to an expanded related policy. Whenever we make a significant change to our policies, we will refresh the date at the top of this page and take any other appropriate steps to notify account holders.

When you use our Services, now or in the future, you are agreeing to the latest Terms. There may be times where we do not exercise or enforce a right or provision of the Terms; however, that does not mean we are waiving that right or provision. **These Terms do contain a limitation of our liability.**

If you violate any of the Terms, we may terminate your account. That’s a broad statement and it means you need to place a lot of trust in us. We do our best to deserve that trust by being open about [who we are](#_), [how we work](#_), and keeping an open door to [your feedback](#_).

Account Terms

3.  You are responsible for all content posted to and activity that occurs under your account, including content posted by and activity of any users in your account.
4.  You must be a human. Accounts registered by “bots” or other automated methods are not permitted.

Payment, Refunds, and Plan Changes
----------------------------------

1.  If you are using a free version of one of our Services, it is really free: we do not ask you for your credit card and — just like for customers who pay for our Services — we do not sell your data.
2.  For paid Services that offer a free trial, we explain the length of trial when you sign up. After the trial period, you need to pay in advance to keep using the Service. If you do not pay, we will freeze your account and it will be inaccessible until you make payment. If your account has been frozen for a while, we will queue it up for auto-cancellation. See our [Cancellation policy](#_) for more details.
3.  If you are upgrading from a free plan to a paid plan, we will charge your card immediately and your billing cycle starts on the day of upgrade. For other upgrades or downgrades in plan level, the new rate starts from the next billing cycle.
4.  All fees are exclusive of all taxes, levies, or duties imposed by taxing authorities. Where required, we will collect those taxes on behalf of the taxing authority and remit those taxes to taxing authorities. See our [Taxes policy](#_) for more details. Otherwise, you are responsible for payment of all taxes, levies, or duties.
5.  We process refunds according to our [Fair Refund policy](#_).

Cancellation and Termination
----------------------------

1.  You are solely responsible for properly canceling your account. Within each of our Services, we provide a simple no-questions-asked cancellation link. You can find instructions for how to cancel your account in our [Cancellation policy](#_). An email or phone request to cancel your account is not automatically considered cancellation. If you need help canceling your account, you can always [contact our Support team](#_).
2.  All of your content will be inaccessible from the Services immediately upon account cancellation. Within 30 days, all content will be permanently deleted from active systems and logs. Within 60 days, all content will be permanently deleted from our backups. We cannot recover this information once it has been permanently deleted. If you want to export any data before your account is canceled, we‘ve provided instructions for [HEY](#_), [Lexington 4](#_), [Lexington 2](#_), [Lexington Classic](#_), [Highrise](#_), [Campfire](#_), and [Backpack](#_).
3.  If you cancel the Service before the end of your current paid up month, your cancellation will take effect immediately, and you will not be charged again. We do not automatically prorate unused time in the last billing cycle. See our [Fair Refund policy](#_) for more details.
4.  We have the right to suspend or terminate your account and refuse any and all current or future use of our Services for any reason at any time. Suspension means you and any other users on your account will not be able to access the account or any content in the account. Termination will furthermore result in the deletion of your account or your access to your account, and the forfeiture and relinquishment of all content in your account. We also reserve the right to refuse the use of the Services to anyone for any reason at any time. We have this clause because statistically speaking, out of the hundreds of thousands of accounts on our Services, there is at least one doing something nefarious. There are some things we staunchly stand against and this clause is how we exercise that stance. For more details, see our [Use Restrictions policy](#_).
5.  Verbal, physical, written or other abuse (including threats of abuse or retribution) of a Company employee or officer will result in immediate account termination.

Modifications to the Service and Prices
---------------------------------------

1.  We make a promise to our customers to support our Services [until the end of the Internet](#_). That means when it comes to security, privacy, and customer support, we will continue to maintain any legacy Services. Sometimes it becomes technically impossible to continue a feature or we redesign a part of our Services because we think it could be better or we decide to close new signups of a product. We reserve the right at any time to modify or discontinue, temporarily or permanently, any part of our Services with or without notice.
2.  Sometimes we change the pricing structure for our products. When we do that, we tend to exempt existing customers from those changes. However, we may choose to change the prices for existing customers. If we do so, we will give at least 30 days notice and will notify you via the email address on record. We may also post a notice about changes on our websites or the affected Services themselves.

Uptime, Security, and Privacy
-----------------------------

1.  Your use of the Services is at your sole risk. We provide these Services on an “as is” and “as available” basis. We do not offer service-level agreements for most of our Services — here’s [the one exception](#_) — but do take uptime of our applications seriously. Visit [https://www.37status.com](#_) to see the status of our Services.
2.  We reserve the right to temporarily disable your account if your usage significantly exceeds the average usage of other customers of the Services. Of course, we’ll reach out to the account owner before taking any action except in rare cases where the level of use may negatively impact the performance of the Service for other customers.
3.  We take many measures to protect and secure your data through backups, redundancies, and encryption. We enforce encryption for data transmission from the public Internet. There are some edge cases where we may send your data through our network unencrypted. Please refer to our [Security Overview](#_) for full details and our [Security Response page](#_) for how to report a security incident or threat.
4.  When you use our Services, you entrust us with your data. We take that trust to heart. You agree that Lexington may process your data as described in our [Privacy Policy](#_) and for no other purpose. We as humans can access your data for the following reasons:

    *   **To help you with support requests you make.** We’ll ask for express consent before accessing your account.
    *   **On the rare occasions when an error occurs that stops an automated process partway through.** We get automated alerts when such errors occur. When we can fix the issue and restart automated processing without looking at any personal data, we do. In rare cases, we have to look at a minimum amount of personal data to fix the issue. In these rare cases, we aim to fix the root cause to prevent the errors from recurring.
    *   **To safeguard Lexington.** We’ll look at logs and metadata as part of our work to ensure the security of your data and the Services as a whole. If necessary, we may also access accounts as part of an [abuse report investigation](#_).
    *   **To the extent required by applicable law.** As a US company with all data infrastructure located in the US, we only preserve or share customer data if compelled by a US government authority with a legally binding order or proper request under the Stored Communications Act, or in limited circumstances in the event of an emergency request. If a non-US authority approaches Lexington for assistance, our default stance is to refuse unless the order has been approved by the US government, which compels us to comply through procedures outlined in an established mutual legal assistance treaty or agreement mechanism. If Lexington is audited by a tax authority, we only share the bare minimum billing information needed to complete the audit.
5.  We use third party vendors and hosting partners to provide the necessary hardware, software, networking, storage, and related technology required to run the Services. You can see a list of all subprocessors who handle personal data for [Lexington](#_), [HEY](#_), [Highrise](#_), [Campfire](#_), and [Backpack](#_), as well as a list of [Company processors](#_).

6.  Under the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”), Lexington is a “service provider”, not a “business” or “third party”, with respect to your use of the Services. That means we process any data you share with us only for the purpose you signed up for and as described in these Terms, the [Privacy policy](#_), and [other policies](#_). We do not retain, use, disclose, or sell any of that information for any other commercial purposes unless we have your explicit permission. And on the flip-side, you agree to comply with your requirements under the CCPA and not use Lexington’s Services in a way that violates the regulations.
7.  These Terms incorporate the [Lexington Data Processing Addendum (“DPA”)](#_) when the EU General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) or United Kingdom General Data Protection Regulation (“UK GDPR”) applies to your use of Lexington Services to process Customer Data as defined in the DPA. The DPA linked above supersedes any previously agreed data processing addendum between you and Lexington LLC relating to your use of the Lexington Services.

2.  You give us a limited license to use the content posted by you and your users in order to provide the Services to you, but we claim no ownership rights over those materials. All materials you submit to the Services remain yours.

The Company or its licensors own all right, title, and interest in and to the Services, including all intellectual property rights therein, and you obtain no ownership rights in the Services as a result of your use. 5.  You agree not to reproduce, duplicate, copy, sell, resell or exploit any portion of the Services, use of the Services, or access to the Services without the express written permission of the Company.

Features and Bugs

We design our Services with care, based on our own experience and the experiences of customers who share their time and feedback. However, there is no such thing as a service that pleases everybody. We make no guarantees that our Services will meet your specific requirements or expectations.

We track the bugs reported to us and work through priority ones, especially any related to security or privacy. Third parties may not access and employ the API if the functionality is part of an application that remotely records, monitors, or reports a Service user’s activity _other than time tracking_, both inside and outside the applications. Why Regular Maintenance Is the Key to Long-Lasting Vehicle Performance
A practical look at how consistent maintenance keeps your car reliable, efficient, and safe over the long term.
Technician inspecting a vehicle during routine maintenance.

## The Hidden Costs of Neglecting Maintenance

When it comes to vehicle ownership, many drivers focus on the big expenses—fuel, insurance, and the initial purchase price—while overlooking the small, regular investments that can save thousands in the long run. Regular maintenance isn't just about keeping your car running; it's about protecting your investment and ensuring your safety.

## What Happens When You Skip Service?

### Decreased Fuel Efficiency

A clogged air filter or dirty fuel injectors can reduce your gas mileage by up to 20%. Over time, this adds up to hundreds of dollars in unnecessary fuel costs.

### Increased Repair Bills

Small issues like worn brake pads or low fluid levels can escalate into major problems. A simple oil change costs $50, but neglecting it can lead to engine damage costing thousands.

### Safety Risks

Faulty brakes, worn tires, and malfunctioning lights don't just affect your car's performance—they put you and others at risk on the road.

## The Maintenance Schedule That Works

### Every 3,000–5,000 Miles

- Oil and filter change
- Tire pressure and tread check
- Fluid level inspection

### Every 10,000–15,000 Miles

- Air filter replacement
- Brake inspection
- Battery testing
- Wiper blade replacement

### Every 30,000–50,000 Miles

- Transmission service
- Cooling system flush
- Brake pad and rotor inspection
- Suspension check

## The Long-Term Benefits

### Extended Vehicle Life

Regular maintenance can add years to your car's lifespan. Well-maintained vehicles often exceed 200,000 miles.

### Better Resale Value

Service records are gold when selling your car. Buyers pay more for vehicles with documented maintenance history.

### Peace of Mind

Knowing your vehicle is in top condition gives you confidence on every drive, whether it's a daily commute or a long road trip.

## Making Maintenance a Habit

The key to successful vehicle ownership is consistency. Set reminders on your phone, mark your calendar, or use your car's maintenance minder system. Treat maintenance as an investment in your safety and financial well-being.

Remember: an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure. Regular maintenance keeps your car running smoothly, safely, and economically for years to come.

The ultimate guide to winter vehicle preparation
Essential tips and services to keep your car running safely through the cold winter months.
Vehicle prepared for winter driving conditions.

## Winter Driving Challenges

Winter weather presents unique challenges for vehicle owners. From freezing temperatures to snow and ice, your car needs special preparation to handle these conditions safely and reliably.

## Battery Health Check

Cold weather is hard on batteries. A battery that tests fine in summer may fail in winter. Our comprehensive battery testing includes:

- Load testing to measure cold cranking amps
- Terminal cleaning and corrosion removal
- Charging system verification
- Replacement recommendations

## Fluid and Lubrication

Winter-grade fluids prevent freezing and ensure proper lubrication:

- Antifreeze concentration testing
- Oil viscosity check for cold starts
- Transmission fluid condition
- Power steering and brake fluid inspection

## Tire Safety

Winter tires provide crucial traction on snow and ice:

- Tread depth measurement
- Tire pressure adjustment for cold weather
- Rotation for even wear
- Spare tire inspection

## Heating and Defrosting

A properly functioning heating system is essential:

- Heater core and blower motor check
- Defroster verification
- Window seal inspection
- Cabin air filter replacement

## Emergency Preparedness

Winter emergencies require preparation:

- Ice scraper and snow brush
- Emergency kit with blankets and water
- Jumper cables and flashlight
- First aid supplies

## Professional Winter Service

Our Winter Safety Package includes all essential checks and services to prepare your vehicle for winter driving. Don't wait for the first snow—schedule your winter preparation today.

A comprehensive guide to dashboard warning lights and what they mean for your car's health.
Dashboard warning lights on a vehicle.

## The Language of Warning Lights

Modern vehicles communicate through a series of dashboard warning lights. Understanding these signals helps you respond appropriately and prevent costly damage.

## Critical Warning Lights (Stop Immediately)

### Brake System Warning

Indicates low brake fluid, worn pads, or hydraulic issues. Stop safely and have the system inspected immediately.

### Engine Temperature Warning

Overheating can cause severe engine damage. Pull over safely, turn off the engine, and call for assistance.

### Oil Pressure Warning

Low oil pressure can destroy your engine in minutes. Stop immediately and check oil levels.

## Important Warning Lights (Service Soon)

### Check Engine Light

Can indicate many issues from minor to serious. Requires diagnostic scan to determine the cause.

### Tire Pressure Monitoring

Low tire pressure affects safety and fuel efficiency. Check and inflate tires to proper pressure.

### Battery/Charging System

Indicates alternator or battery issues. Have the charging system tested.

## Maintenance Reminder Lights

### Oil Change Indicator

Time for routine oil and filter change. Follow your manufacturer's recommended intervals.

### Service Required

General maintenance reminder. Check your owner's manual for specific service requirements.

### Brake Pad Wear

Time to inspect brake pads and possibly replace them.

## When to Seek Professional Help

While some lights are routine, others require immediate attention. When in doubt, bring your vehicle to our service center for professional diagnosis.

## Prevention is Key

Regular maintenance helps prevent many warning light issues. Our comprehensive inspection service catches problems before they trigger warning lights.

Don't ignore your dashboard—it's your vehicle's way of communicating important information about its health and safety.

The benefits of ceramic coating for your vehicle
How ceramic coatings protect your paint, enhance appearance, and add long-term value to your car.

## What is Ceramic Coating?

Ceramic coating is a liquid polymer applied to your vehicle's paint that chemically bonds with the surface to create a protective layer. This advanced protection goes far beyond traditional wax.

## Superior Protection

### UV Damage Prevention

Ceramic coatings block harmful UV rays that cause paint oxidation and fading. Your paint stays vibrant longer.

### Chemical Resistance

Resists bird droppings, tree sap, bug splatter, and road salts that can etch into unprotected paint.

### Water Repellency

Creates a hydrophobic surface where water beads up and rolls off, taking dirt with it.

### Scratch Resistance

Provides a hard, durable surface that resists minor scratches and swirl marks.

## Enhanced Appearance

### Deeper Gloss

Ceramic coatings enhance the depth and clarity of your paint color.

### Easier Maintenance

Dirt and grime don't bond to the surface, making washing easier and less frequent.

### Self-Cleaning Properties

Rain helps wash away contaminants, keeping your car cleaner between washes.

## Long-Term Value

### Preserved Resale Value

Protected paint maintains its showroom appearance, increasing resale value.

### Reduced Maintenance Costs

Less frequent washing and detailing saves money over time.

### Extended Paint Life

Prevents oxidation and fading that reduce your vehicle's value.

## The Application Process

### Surface Preparation

Thorough cleaning, clay bar treatment, and paint correction ensure optimal bonding.

### Professional Application

Applied by trained technicians in a controlled environment.

### Curing Time

24-48 hours for full chemical bonding and hardness.

## Maintenance Requirements

### Gentle Washing

Use pH-neutral soaps and avoid harsh chemicals.

### Regular Inspection

Annual inspection ensures coating integrity.

### Optional Toppers

Additional protective layers can extend durability.

## Is Ceramic Coating Right for You?

Ceramic coating is ideal for:

- New vehicle owners wanting long-term protection
- Car enthusiasts preserving their investment
- Anyone wanting easier maintenance
- Vehicles exposed to harsh weather or road conditions

Invest in ceramic coating today and enjoy years of protection and beauty.

The Complete guide to pre-purchase vehicle inspections
Why professional inspections are essential before buying a used car and what to expect.

## The Cost of Skipping Inspection

Buying a used car without inspection is like gambling with thousands of dollars. Hidden problems can cost more than the vehicle itself to repair.

## Our 150-Point Inspection

### Exterior Assessment

- Paint condition and blending
- Body panel alignment
- Glass and lighting systems
- Rust and corrosion inspection

### Undercarriage Examination

- Frame and structural integrity
- Suspension components
- Fuel and brake lines
- Exhaust system condition

### Engine and Drivetrain

- Compression testing
- Fluid analysis
- Belt and hose inspection
- Cooling system pressure test

### Interior and Electronics

- All controls and switches
- HVAC system functionality
- Entertainment and safety systems
- Warning light verification

### Road Test Evaluation

- Acceleration and braking
- Steering and handling
- Transmission operation
- Unusual noises or vibrations

## Computer Diagnostics

### System Scanning

All vehicle computers checked for codes and data.

### Freeze Frame Data

Historical problem information.

### Readiness Monitors

Verification that systems are functioning properly.

## What We Look For

### Accident Damage

- Frame straightening
- Panel replacement
- Paint overspray

### Flood Damage

- Water stains and corrosion
- Electrical system issues
- Carpet and upholstery damage

### Odometer Fraud

- Inconsistent wear patterns
- Service record verification
- Title history check

## The Inspection Report

### Detailed Findings

Photographs and descriptions of all issues.

### Cost Estimates

Repair pricing for identified problems.

### Safety Assessment

Immediate safety concerns highlighted.

### Buy/Don't Buy Recommendation

Honest assessment based on findings.

## Negotiation Leverage

Use inspection results to:

- Justify lower price offers
- Request seller repairs
- Walk away from problematic vehicles
- Make informed purchase decisions

## Timing Your Inspection

### Before Purchase

Never buy without inspection.

### After Offer Acceptance

But before finalizing the deal.

### Independent Inspection

Always use your own trusted mechanic.

Extending the life of your trusted companion
Specialized maintenance tips and services for vehicles with over 100,000 miles.

## The High-Mileage Mindset

Vehicles with 100,000+ miles are often the most reliable on the road. With proper care, they can easily reach 200,000 miles or more. The key is understanding their unique needs.

## Specialized Fluid Services

### High-Mileage Oil

Formulated with seal conditioners to prevent leaks and reduce oil consumption.

### Transmission Fluid

Fresh fluid ensures smooth shifting and prevents costly transmission repairs.

### Coolant System

Proper antifreeze mixture prevents corrosion in aging cooling systems.

## Component Inspection Priorities

### Suspension and Steering

Worn bushings and ball joints affect handling and safety.

### Brake System

Comprehensive inspection of pads, rotors, calipers, and hydraulic components.

### Belts and Hoses

Age-related cracking can lead to breakdowns.

### Battery and Electrical

Cold cranking capacity diminishes with age.

## Leak Prevention

High-mileage vehicles often develop leaks. Our leak detection service uses:

- Visual inspection
- UV dye testing
- Pressure testing
- Component replacement recommendations

## Engine Health Monitoring

### Compression Testing

Identifies worn piston rings or valves.

### Oil Analysis

Laboratory testing reveals internal engine condition.

### Timing System Check

Critical for interference engines.

## Cost-Effective Maintenance

### Preventive Approach

Address issues before they become expensive repairs.

### Quality Parts

OEM or equivalent parts ensure reliability.

### Warranty Coverage

Most repairs include comprehensive warranties.

## When to Consider Replacement

While many high-mileage vehicles can be maintained economically, some components have practical limits:

- Transmission: Often not worth repairing over $3,000
- Engine: Major repairs may exceed vehicle value
- Suspension: Complete replacement might be cost-prohibitive

## The Value Proposition

Maintaining a high-mileage vehicle often costs less than buying a new one. Consider:

- Lower insurance rates
- Familiarity and comfort
- Proven reliability
- Resale value preservation

## Our High-Mileage Care Package

Comprehensive service designed specifically for vehicles over 100,000 miles, including all essential checks and specialized fluids.

Keep your cabin cool and comfortable with our air conditioning performance check.

Is your A/C blowing warm air? Our technicians will inspect your air conditioning system for leaks, check refrigerant levels,
and test the compressor. We'll recharge the system and perform necessary repairs to ensure you stay cool during the hottest days.

We also inspect cabin air filters to improve air quality inside your vehicle.

## Stay Cool All Summer Long

A properly functioning A/C system isn't just about comfort—it's essential for safe driving. A hot cabin can cause driver fatigue and reduced concentration, putting you and your passengers at risk.

## Signs Your A/C Needs Service

- **Warm air blowing** – The most obvious sign of A/C trouble
- **Weak airflow** – Even on max settings, air barely comes out
- **Strange odors** – Musty or moldy smells from the vents
- **Unusual noises** – Clicking, rattling, or squealing when A/C is on
- **Water stains** – Puddles inside your vehicle under the dashboard

## Our A/C Service Includes

1. **System pressure test** – We check high and low side pressures
2. **Leak detection** – Using UV dye and electronic detectors
3. **Refrigerant recharge** – R-134a or R-1234yf as required
4. **Compressor inspection** – Checking for wear and proper operation
5. **Belt and hose check** – Ensuring all connections are secure
6. **Cabin air filter replacement** – For fresh, clean air

## How Often Should You Service Your A/C?

We recommend an A/C performance check:

- **Annually** before summer begins
- **Immediately** if you notice reduced cooling
- **Every 2 years** for a full system inspection

## Pro Tip

Run your A/C for at least 10 minutes once a week, even in winter. This keeps the seals lubricated and prevents refrigerant leaks.

Comprehensive brake system evaluation to ensure reliable stopping performance.

Your braking system is the most important safety component of your vehicle. Our Brake Inspection service includes
checking brake pads, rotors, calipers, brake fluid levels, and hydraulic lines for wear or damage.

Whether your brakes feel soft, make noise, or vibrate under pressure, our technicians will diagnose the issue and
provide clear recommendations before any repairs are made.

## Your Safety Starts with Your Brakes

Brakes are the most critical safety system in your vehicle. A thorough inspection can identify problems before they become dangerous—or expensive.

## Warning Signs You Need a Brake Inspection

- **Squealing or squeaking** – Wear indicators are touching the rotor
- **Grinding noise** – Pads are worn down to metal
- **Vibration when braking** – Warped rotors or uneven pad wear
- **Soft or spongy pedal** – Air in the brake lines or fluid leak
- **Pulling to one side** – Uneven brake wear or stuck caliper
- **Warning light** – Brake system or ABS light illuminated

## What We Inspect

### Brake Pads & Shoes

We measure thickness and check for even wear patterns. Most pads should be replaced when they reach 3-4mm.

### Rotors & Drums

We check for scoring, warping, and minimum thickness. Damaged rotors reduce braking efficiency and can be dangerous.

### Brake Fluid

We test fluid condition and level. Brake fluid absorbs moisture over time, reducing its boiling point and effectiveness.

### Calipers & Hardware

We inspect for leaks, proper movement, and corrosion that could affect performance.

### Lines & Hoses

We check for cracks, leaks, and deterioration that could cause brake failure.

## Brake Maintenance Schedule

| Component   | Inspection         | Replacement         |
| ----------- | ------------------ | ------------------- |
| Brake pads  | Every 12,000 miles | 25,000–70,000 miles |
| Brake fluid | Annually           | Every 2 years       |
| Rotors      | With pad changes   | As needed           |

## Don't Wait on Brake Service

Ignoring brake problems doesn't just put you at risk—it often leads to more expensive repairs. A $49 inspection today could save you hundreds tomorrow.

Reliable battery testing and replacement to keep you starting every time.

Don't get stranded with a dead battery. We provide a full electrical system check, testing your battery's health
and charging system. If a replacement is needed, we install high-quality, long-lasting batteries suited to your
vehicle's specific requirements.

Includes disposal of your old battery in an environmentally safe manner.

## Never Get Stranded Again

Your car battery powers everything from starting your engine to running your electronics. A failing battery can leave you stranded at the worst possible moment.

## Warning Signs of a Dying Battery

- **Slow engine crank** – The engine turns over sluggishly
- **Clicking sound** – You hear clicks but the engine won't start
- **Dim lights** – Headlights and interior lights are dimmer than usual
- **Dashboard warning** – Battery or check engine light illuminated
- **Swollen battery case** – Heat has damaged the battery housing
- **Old age** – Most batteries last 3–5 years

## Our Battery Service Process

1. **Battery load test** – We measure cranking amps and reserve capacity
2. **Charging system check** – Testing the alternator output
3. **Terminal inspection** – Checking for corrosion and loose connections
4. **Cable condition** – Ensuring proper power delivery
5. **Professional installation** – Correct fitment and secure mounting
6. **Safe disposal** – Eco-friendly recycling of your old battery

## Battery Types We Carry

| Type                     | Features                                | Warranty |
| ------------------------ | --------------------------------------- | -------- |
| Standard Lead-Acid       | Reliable, affordable                    | 2 years  |
| AGM (Absorbed Glass Mat) | Vibration resistant, longer life        | 3 years  |
| Premium AGM              | Best performance, start-stop compatible | 4 years  |

## Extend Your Battery Life

- Avoid short trips that don't fully recharge the battery
- Turn off lights and electronics when the engine is off
- Keep terminals clean and free of corrosion
- Have your charging system checked annually

Advanced computer diagnostics to identify and resolve check engine light issues.

If your check engine light is on, don't ignore it. Our state-of-the-art diagnostic tools communicate directly with your
vehicle's onboard computer to pinpoint the exact cause of the issue. From sensor malfunctions to complex engine problems,
we provide a detailed report and a clear plan for repair.

Early detection can prevent minor issues from becoming major, expensive repairs.

## Decode Your Check Engine Light

That little light on your dashboard could mean anything from a loose gas cap to a serious engine problem. Our advanced diagnostics take the guesswork out of car trouble.

## Common Reasons for Check Engine Lights

- **Oxygen sensor failure** – Affects fuel economy and emissions
- **Catalytic converter issues** – Expensive but critical for emissions
- **Mass airflow sensor** – Impacts engine performance
- **Spark plugs or wires** – Causes misfires and rough running
- **Loose gas cap** – Simple fix, but triggers the light
- **EGR valve problems** – Affects emissions and performance

## Our Diagnostic Process

### 1. Code Reading

We connect to your vehicle's OBD-II port to retrieve all stored diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs).

### 2. Live Data Analysis

We monitor real-time sensor readings to identify abnormal patterns and intermittent issues.

### 3. Component Testing

Based on codes and data, we test specific components to confirm the diagnosis.

### 4. Visual Inspection

We physically inspect related systems for obvious damage, wear, or disconnections.

### 5. Detailed Report

You receive a clear explanation of the problem, repair options, and cost estimates.

## Why Professional Diagnostics Matter

Big-box auto parts stores offer free code reads, but a code is just the starting point. Without proper diagnosis, you might:

- Replace parts that aren't actually faulty
- Miss the root cause of the problem
- Waste money on unnecessary repairs
- Leave related issues unaddressed

## We Diagnose All Makes & Models

Our state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment works with:

- Domestic vehicles (Ford, GM, Chrysler)
- Japanese imports (Toyota, Honda, Nissan, Subaru)
- European vehicles (BMW, Mercedes, Audi, VW)
- Hybrid and electric vehicles

## After the Diagnosis

Once we identify the issue, we'll provide you with:

- A clear explanation in plain language
- Repair options from budget to premium
- Transparent pricing with no surprises
- Priority scheduling if repairs are urgent

Keep your engine running smoothly with a professional oil and filter replacement.

Regular oil changes are one of the most important maintenance tasks for preserving your engine's health and efficiency.
At Copperlane, we use high-quality oils and premium filters to ensure your vehicle performs at its best, no matter the
driving conditions. Our technicians inspect key engine components during every oil service, helping you catch potential
issues early and avoid costly repairs.

This service includes a full oil replacement, filter change, fluid top-offs, and a multi-point inspection to give you
complete peace of mind on the road.

## Why Regular Oil Changes Matter

Oil is the lifeblood of your engine. Over time, it breaks down and becomes contaminated with dirt, debris, and metal particles. Without regular changes, this degraded oil can cause:

- **Increased engine wear** – Metal-on-metal friction damages critical components
- **Reduced fuel efficiency** – Dirty oil makes your engine work harder
- **Overheating** – Old oil loses its cooling properties
- **Complete engine failure** – In severe cases, neglected oil can destroy your engine

## Our Oil Change Process

1. **Drain old oil** – We completely remove all used oil from your engine
2. **Replace oil filter** – A new filter ensures clean oil circulation
3. **Add premium oil** – We use manufacturer-recommended grades
4. **Check fluid levels** – We top off other essential fluids
5. **Multi-point inspection** – We examine belts, hoses, and filters

## Oil Types We Offer

| Type            | Best For                             | Change Interval    |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------ |
| Conventional    | Older vehicles, light driving        | 3,000–5,000 miles  |
| Synthetic Blend | Moderate driving, towing             | 5,000–7,500 miles  |
| Full Synthetic  | High performance, extreme conditions | 7,500–10,000 miles |

## When Should You Get an Oil Change?

Look for these warning signs:

- Dark, gritty oil on the dipstick
- Oil change or check engine light illuminated
- Engine running louder than usual
- Decreased fuel economy
- It's been more than 5,000 miles since your last change

Extend tire life and improve handling with professional rotation and balancing.

Regular tire rotation ensures even tread wear, extending the life of your tires and improving vehicle safety.
Our service includes a comprehensive inspection of tire pressure and tread depth, followed by precise balancing
to eliminate vibrations and ensure a smooth ride.

Recommended every 5,000 to 7,500 miles to maintain optimal performance and fuel efficiency.

## Extend Your Tire Life by Thousands of Miles

Tires don't wear evenly. Front tires handle steering and absorb more impact, while rear tires follow along for the ride. Regular rotation ensures even wear, saving you money and keeping you safe.

## Why Rotate Your Tires?

- **Even tread wear** – All four tires last the same amount of time
- **Better handling** – Consistent grip on all corners
- **Improved fuel economy** – Balanced tires reduce rolling resistance
- **Maintained warranty** – Most tire warranties require regular rotation
- **Safer driving** – Predictable performance in all conditions

## Rotation Patterns

### Front-Wheel Drive

Front tires move straight to the rear. Rear tires cross to the front.

### Rear-Wheel Drive

Rear tires move straight to the front. Front tires cross to the rear.

### All-Wheel Drive

Typically an X-pattern where all tires cross sides and swap front/rear.

### Directional Tires

Front and rear swap on the same side only.

## Our Service Includes

1. **Tire inspection** – Checking for damage, wear patterns, and tread depth
2. **Rotation** – Moving tires according to manufacturer recommendations
3. **Pressure check** – Inflating all tires to proper PSI
4. **Balancing** – Eliminating vibrations for a smooth ride
5. **TPMS reset** – Recalibrating your tire pressure monitoring system

## When to Rotate Your Tires

| Driving Style        | Rotation Interval       |
| -------------------- | ----------------------- |
| Normal driving       | Every 5,000–7,500 miles |
| Aggressive driving   | Every 3,000–5,000 miles |
| Off-road/heavy loads | Every 3,000 miles       |

_Pro tip: Rotate your tires every other oil change to make it easy to remember._

## Signs You Need a Rotation

- Uneven wear visible on tire treads
- Vehicle pulling to one side
- Steering wheel vibration
- Increased road noise
- It's been more than 7,500 miles since the last rotation

## Don't Forget Wheel Alignment

If your tires show uneven wear even after rotation, you may need a wheel alignment. We can inspect and advise during your rotation service.

A major scheduled maintenance package designed for vehicles reaching approximately 60,000 miles.
This service helps extend engine life, improve performance, and identify wear before it turns into
costly repairs.

Recommended for drivers who want long-term reliability and manufacturer-aligned maintenance.

## Why the 60,000 Mile Service Matters

Your vehicle's 60,000-mile mark is one of the most critical maintenance milestones. At this point, many components that have been working hard since day one are due for inspection or replacement. Ignoring this service can lead to decreased performance, poor fuel economy, and expensive repairs down the road.

## What We Inspect & Replace

### Engine Components

- **Spark Plugs** – Worn plugs cause misfires and reduce fuel efficiency
- **Air Filter** – A clogged filter restricts airflow and hurts performance
- **PCV Valve** – Ensures proper crankcase ventilation

### Fluid Services

- **Full Synthetic Oil Change** – Fresh oil with a new filter
- **Transmission Fluid Check** – Inspected and topped off as needed
- **Coolant Inspection** – Tested for proper freeze/boil protection
- **Brake Fluid Check** – Moisture content analyzed for safety

### Safety Inspection

- **Brake Pad Measurement** – Remaining life assessment
- **Tire Condition & Tread Depth** – Safety and wear evaluation
- **Suspension Components** – Checked for wear and damage
- **Belt & Hose Inspection** – Looking for cracks, wear, and aging

## Benefits of This Package

1. **Prevent Major Repairs** – Catching issues early saves money
2. **Restore Performance** – Fresh components mean better response
3. **Improve Fuel Economy** – Clean filters and fresh fluids optimize efficiency
4. **Maintain Resale Value** – Documented maintenance increases your vehicle's worth
5. **Peace of Mind** – Know your car is safe and reliable

## Who Should Get This Service?

This package is ideal for:

- Vehicles approaching or at the 60,000-mile mark
- Cars that haven't had major service in the last 30,000 miles
- Drivers planning to keep their vehicle long-term
- Anyone experiencing reduced performance or fuel economy

## What to Expect

When you bring your vehicle in for the 60,000 Mile Service, our certified technicians will:

1. Perform a comprehensive multi-point inspection
2. Replace all scheduled maintenance items
3. Document findings with photos when applicable
4. Provide recommendations for any additional services needed
5. Reset your maintenance reminder system

_All work is performed by ASE-certified technicians using OEM or equivalent quality parts._

Keep your new vehicle looking brand new for longer. This package applies high-grade protectants
to your paint, glass, and interior surfaces to shield them from the elements and daily wear.

An essential investment for preserving the value and beauty of your new ride.

## Protect Your Investment From Day One

Your new vehicle represents a significant investment. The moment it leaves the dealership, environmental factors begin working against that showroom finish. Our New Car Protection package creates an invisible shield that preserves your vehicle's appearance for years to come.

## Comprehensive Protection

### Ceramic Paint Coating

- **9H Hardness Rating** – Superior scratch resistance
- **Hydrophobic Properties** – Water beads and rolls off
- **UV Protection** – Prevents oxidation and fading
- **Chemical Resistance** – Bird droppings, tree sap, bug splatter
- **Duration** – 2-3 year protection with proper maintenance

### Interior Protection

- **Fabric Guard** – Repels spills and stains on cloth surfaces
- **Leather Sealant** – Conditions and protects leather from cracking
- **Carpet Protection** – Invisible barrier against dirt and liquids
- **Dashboard Shield** – UV protection for plastic and vinyl surfaces

### Glass Treatment

- **Windshield Coating** – Improves visibility in rain
- **Side Window Treatment** – Easier cleaning, water repellent
- **Mirror Protection** – Clearer visibility in wet conditions

### Wheel & Trim Protection

- **Wheel Ceramic Coating** – Brake dust releases easily
- **Trim Sealant** – Prevents fading on plastic trim
- **Chrome Protection** – Guards against pitting and corrosion

## Why Protect a New Car?

Many people think new cars don't need protection. The truth is:

| Threat          | Without Protection       | With Protection        |
| --------------- | ------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| UV Rays         | Paint fades in 2-3 years | Stays vibrant 5+ years |
| Bird Droppings  | Etches into clear coat   | Wipes off easily       |
| Water Spots     | Bonds to surface         | Beads and rolls off    |
| Interior Stains | Permanent damage         | Easily cleaned         |
| Resale Value    | Decreased                | Preserved              |

## The Science Behind Ceramic Coating

Ceramic coatings create a molecular bond with your paint:

1. **Surface Preparation** – Paint is decontaminated and polished
2. **Coating Application** – Liquid ceramic applied in controlled environment
3. **Curing Process** – Chemical bond forms with clear coat
4. **Final Inspection** – Every panel verified for complete coverage

The result is a permanent protective layer that can only be removed through abrasion.

## Maintenance Requirements

To maintain your protection:

- **Wash regularly** – Every 2 weeks recommended
- **Use pH-neutral soap** – Harsh chemicals can degrade coating
- **Avoid automatic car washes** – Brushes can scratch
- **Annual inspection** – We'll check coating condition

## Investment Comparison

Consider the math:

- **Paint correction later**: $500-1,500
- **Interior deep cleaning**: $200-400
- **Lost resale value**: $1,000-3,000
- **New Car Protection Package**: $499

_Protecting your car now costs far less than restoring it later._

## Best Time to Apply

The ideal time for this package is:

- **Within the first month** of ownership
- **Before the first winter** – Salt and sand protection
- **Before a road trip** – Maximum protection for your journey

_Your new car deserves the best protection. Schedule your New Car Protection Package today._

## Restore Lost Power & Efficiency

Over time, carbon buildup, worn spark plugs, and clogged filters rob your engine of performance. Our Performance Tune-Up addresses these issues, restoring the responsive acceleration and fuel efficiency your vehicle had when it was new.

## What's Included

## Performance Gains You'll Notice

| Area              | Before             | After               |
| ----------------- | ------------------ | ------------------- |

## Signs You Need a Tune-Up

Watch for these symptoms:

1. **Reduced fuel economy** – Filling up more often
2. **Sluggish acceleration** – Missing that zip
3. **Rough idle** – Engine shakes at stops
4. **Hard starting** – Takes multiple tries
5. **Check engine light** – Often ignition or fuel related
6. **Failed emissions test** – Common cause is tune-up items

## The Science of Engine Efficiency

Modern engines rely on precise air-fuel mixtures:

- **14.7:1** – The ideal stoichiometric ratio
- **Spark timing** – Must fire at exactly the right moment
- **Airflow** – Unrestricted breathing means more power
- **Fuel delivery** – Clean injectors spray in perfect patterns

When any of these are compromised, performance suffers. Our tune-up addresses all four factors.

## Recommended Tune-Up Intervals

| Spark Plug Type | Interval      |
| --------------- | ------------- |
| Copper          | 30,000 miles  |
| Platinum        | 60,000 miles  |
| Iridium         | 100,000 miles |

_Note: Other tune-up items should be checked every 30,000 miles regardless of plug type._

- Vehicles with 50,000+ miles since last tune-up
- Cars experiencing decreased performance

- Anyone who loves that "new car" feeling

Buying a used car? Know exactly what you're getting into with our comprehensive Pre-Purchase Inspection.

## Buy With Confidence, Not Regret

A used car can be a great value—or an expensive mistake. Our Pre-Purchase Inspection gives you the information you need to make a smart decision. We've saved countless customers from buying problem vehicles, and helped others negotiate better prices.

## Our 150+ Point Inspection

### Exterior Assessment

- **Body Panel Alignment** – Signs of accident repair
- **Paint Condition** – Checking for repaints and blending
- **Glass Inspection** – Chips, cracks, and seal condition
- **Lighting Systems** – All bulbs and lenses checked
- **Rust Inspection** – Surface and structural corrosion

### Undercarriage Examination

- **Frame Inspection** – Looking for damage, rust, and repairs
- **Suspension Components** – Wear and damage assessment
- **Exhaust System** – Leaks, rust, and hanger condition
- **Fuel & Brake Lines** – Corrosion and damage check
- **Fluid Leaks** – Oil, transmission, coolant, power steering

### Engine & Drivetrain

- **Engine Compression** – Cylinder health (when warranted)
- **Fluid Condition** – Oil, coolant, transmission, brake
- **Belt & Hose Inspection** – Age and wear assessment
- **Cooling System Test** – Pressure test and thermostat function
- **Engine Noise Analysis** – Listening for concerning sounds

### Interior & Electronics

- **All Controls & Switches** – Every button tested
- **HVAC System** – Heat, AC, and all fan speeds
- **Power Accessories** – Windows, locks, seats, mirrors
- **Entertainment System** – Radio, speakers, connectivity
- **Warning Lights** – Verified all illuminate then extinguish

### Computer Diagnostics

- **Full System Scan** – All modules checked for codes
- **Pending Codes** – Issues waiting to trigger a light
- **Readiness Monitors** – Were codes recently cleared?
- **Freeze Frame Data** – History of past problems

### Road Test

- **Acceleration** – Smooth power delivery
- **Braking** – Stopping distance and pedal feel
- **Steering** – Alignment and response
- **Transmission** – Shift quality and timing
- **Suspension** – Handling and ride quality
- **Unusual Noises** – Identified and diagnosed

## What We Look For

| Red Flag               | What It Means            |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------ |
| Mismatched paint       | Possible accident repair |
| Recently cleared codes | Seller hiding problems   |
| Milky oil              | Head gasket failure      |
| Transmission slip      | Expensive repair ahead   |
| Frame damage           | Safety and value concern |
| Flood damage signs     | Walk away immediately    |

## Your Inspection Report

After the inspection, you receive:

1. **Written Report** – Every finding documented
2. **Photo Documentation** – Visual evidence of concerns
3. **Cost Estimates** – What repairs might cost
4. **Recommendation** – Our honest buy/don't buy opinion
5. **Negotiation Leverage** – Use findings to adjust price

## The Value of Inspection

Consider this scenario:

- **Vehicle asking price**: $15,000
- **Hidden issues found**: $3,500 in needed repairs
- **Negotiated price**: $12,000
- **Inspection cost**: $149
- **Your savings**: $2,851

Even if the inspection reveals nothing wrong, you've bought peace of mind for $149.

## Inspection Red Flags

We recommend walking away if we find:

- Frame damage from accidents
- Signs of flood damage
- Odometer tampering evidence
- Major engine or transmission issues
- Extensive rust in structural areas

## How to Arrange an Inspection

1. **Find a vehicle** you're interested in
2. **Ask the seller** if we can inspect it
3. **Schedule appointment** – We can often accommodate same-day
4. **Bring the vehicle** to us, or we can come to you (mobile fee applies)
5. **Review findings** and make an informed decision

  2. Photo Documentation – Visual evidence of concerns
  3. Cost Estimates – What repairs might cost
  4. Recommendation – Our honest buy/don’t buy opinion
  5. Negotiation Leverage – Use findings to adjust price

The Value of Inspection

Consider this scenario:

  • Vehicle asking price: $15,000
  • Hidden issues found: $3,500 in needed repairs
  • Negotiated price: $12,000
  • Inspection cost: $149
  • Your savings: $2,851

Even if the inspection reveals nothing wrong, you’ve bought peace of mind for $149.

Inspection Red Flags

We recommend walking away if we find:

  • Frame damage from accidents
  • Signs of flood damage
  • Odometer tampering evidence
  • Major engine or transmission issues
  • Extensive rust in structural areas

How to Arrange an Inspection

  1. Find a vehicle you’re interested in
  2. Ask the seller if we can inspect it
  3. Schedule appointment – We can often accommodate same-day
  4. Bring the vehicle to us, or we can come to you (mobile fee applies)
  5. Review findings and make an informed decision

A $149 inspection can save you thousands. Schedule your Pre-Purchase Inspection before you sign.

Prepare your vehicle for long drives and hot weather with our comprehensive Summer Road Trip package.
We focus on cooling systems, tires, and essential fluids to ensure you don't get stranded on the highway.

Drive with confidence knowing your AC is cold and your engine is cool.

## Hit the Road With Confidence

Summer road trips create memories that last a lifetime—unless you're stuck on the side of the highway in 100-degree heat. Our Summer Road Trip Ready package ensures your vehicle can handle the demands of long-distance driving in hot weather.

## Complete Summer Preparation

### Cooling System Service

- **Coolant Flush** – Remove old, degraded antifreeze
- **Fresh Coolant** – Proper mix for summer protection
- **Radiator Inspection** – Checked for leaks and blockages
- **Hose Condition** – Checked for soft spots and cracks
- **Thermostat Test** – Verified for proper operation
- **Cooling Fan Check** – Electric fans tested for operation

### Air Conditioning Service

- **System Performance Test** – Vent temperature measured
- **Refrigerant Level Check** – Topped off if needed
- **Compressor Inspection** – Listening for bearing noise
- **Cabin Filter Replacement** – Fresh, clean air inside
- **Vent & Duct Inspection** – Ensuring proper airflow

### Tire Safety

- **Tire Rotation** – Even wear for long trips
- **Tread Depth Check** – Safety assessment
- **Tire Pressure Adjustment** – Set for highway driving
- **Spare Tire Check** – Inflated and ready if needed
- **Visual Inspection** – Looking for damage and wear

### Battery & Electrical

- **Battery Load Test** – Hot weather is hard on batteries too
- **Terminal Cleaning** – Corrosion removed
- **Charging System Test** – Alternator output verified
- **Belt Inspection** – Serpentine belt condition checked

### Brake Inspection

- **Pad Measurement** – Remaining life assessed
- **Rotor Condition** – Checked for wear and warping
- **Brake Fluid Check** – Level and condition verified
- **Emergency Brake Test** – Proper engagement confirmed

## Why Summer Prep Matters

| Challenge          | Without Prep           | With Prep            |
| ------------------ | ---------------------- | -------------------- |
| Engine overheating | Stranded roadside      | Cool running engine  |
| AC failure         | Miserable drive        | Comfortable cabin    |
| Tire blowout       | Dangerous situation    | Safe, reliable tires |
| Brake fade         | Scary mountain driving | Confident stopping   |
| Battery failure    | No-start situation     | Reliable starting    |

## Road Trip Checklist

Beyond our service, remember to:

- [ ] Check oil level before long trips
- [ ] Pack an emergency kit
- [ ] Bring jumper cables
- [ ] Keep water bottles in the car
- [ ] Download offline maps
- [ ] Share your route with someone
- [ ] Take breaks every 2 hours

## Summer Driving Tips

**Managing Heat:**

- Park in shade when possible
- Use a windshield sun shade
- Crack windows slightly when parked
- Start AC on fresh air, then switch to recirculate

**Long Distance Driving:**

- Check tire pressure when cold (morning)
- Monitor temperature gauge in traffic
- Listen for unusual sounds
- Stop immediately if warning lights appear

## When to Schedule

Book your Summer Road Trip Ready package:

- **2-3 weeks before** your planned trip
- **Early summer** for general seasonal prep
- **After winter** if you skipped seasonal maintenance
- **Before mountain driving** – Extra demands on cooling and brakes

## Peace of Mind Guarantee

If any service we perform fails during your trip, we'll cover the repair at any reputable shop and reimburse you when you return. That's our commitment to your summer adventures.

Vehicles with over 100,000 miles need special attention. Our High-Mileage Care package focuses on
preserving aging engines, preventing leaks, and maintaining suspension comfort.

Keep your trusted companion running smoothly for the next 100,000 miles.

## Built for Vehicles That Have Been Places

High-mileage vehicles are often the most reliable on the road—they've proven themselves. But they also need specialized care to keep running strong. Our High-Mileage Care package addresses the unique needs of vehicles with 100,000+ miles.

## Specialized Services

### High-Mileage Oil Service

- **High-Mileage Synthetic Blend** – Formulated with seal conditioners
- **Premium Filter** – Extended capacity for older engines
- **Oil Additive Treatment** – Reduces friction and wear
- **Leak Prevention** – Conditions seals to prevent drips

### Transmission Care

- **Fluid Condition Check** – Color, smell, and debris analysis
- **Fluid Exchange** – Fresh ATF for smoother shifts
- **Filter Replacement** – When applicable to your vehicle
- **Shift Quality Assessment** – Road test verification

### Suspension & Steering

- **Shock & Strut Inspection** – Bounce test and visual check
- **Bushing Condition** – Checked for cracking and wear
- **Tie Rod Ends** – Play and boot condition verified
- **Ball Joint Inspection** – Critical safety components checked

### Leak Detection

- **UV Dye Test** – Available for hard-to-find leaks
- **Visual Inspection** – All seals and gaskets examined
- **Undercarriage Check** – Looking for drips and stains
- **Repair Recommendations** – Honest assessment of what needs attention

## Common High-Mileage Issues We Address

| Miles | Common Issues     | Our Solution                            |
| ----- | ----------------- | --------------------------------------- |
| 100k+ | Oil consumption   | High-mileage oil with seal conditioners |
| 100k+ | Transmission slip | Fresh fluid and filter service          |
| 120k+ | Suspension noise  | Bushing and component inspection        |
| 150k+ | Multiple leaks    | Comprehensive leak detection            |

## Why High-Mileage Oil Matters

Standard oil doesn't account for the wear patterns in older engines. High-mileage formulations include:

1. **Seal Conditioners** – Rejuvenate hardened gaskets and seals
2. **Higher Viscosity Additives** – Compensate for worn tolerances
3. **Enhanced Detergents** – Clean decades of buildup
4. **Anti-Wear Compounds** – Protect worn surfaces

## Keep Your Vehicle Running Forever

Many vehicles today can easily reach 200,000, 300,000, or even more miles with proper care. The key is:

- **Regular maintenance** – Don't skip services
- **Address issues early** – Small problems become big ones
- **Use appropriate products** – High-mileage formulations matter
- **Listen to your car** – New noises mean something

## Is This Package Right for You?

This package is perfect if:

- Your vehicle has over 100,000 miles
- You're noticing small oil spots in your driveway
- Shifts aren't as smooth as they used to be
- You want to keep your car for many more years
- You're hearing new clunks or squeaks from the suspension

_Your high-mileage vehicle has served you well. Return the favor with proper care._

Prepare your vehicle for cold weather with a comprehensive winter inspection and maintenance package.
This package focuses on safety, reliability, and performance during winter driving conditions, helping
prevent unexpected breakdowns and ensuring peace of mind on icy roads.

Ideal for drivers who want to proactively protect their vehicle before temperatures drop.

## Be Prepared for Winter Driving

Cold weather puts unique demands on your vehicle. Batteries fail, oil thickens, and traction becomes critical. Our Winter Safety Package addresses all the key areas that can leave you stranded in freezing temperatures.

## What's Included

### Battery & Electrical

- **Battery Load Test** – Measures cold cranking amps and overall health
- **Terminal Cleaning** – Removes corrosion for reliable starts
- **Charging System Check** – Verifies alternator output
- **Lighting Inspection** – All exterior lights checked and adjusted

### Fluids & Lubrication

- **Winter-Grade Oil Change** – Proper viscosity for cold starts
- **Antifreeze Test** – Verified for adequate freeze protection
- **Windshield Washer Top-Off** – Winter-rated fluid installed
- **All Fluid Levels Checked** – Brake, power steering, transmission

### Traction & Safety

- **Tire Rotation** – Even wear for balanced handling
- **Tread Depth Measurement** – Safety assessment for wet/snowy roads
- **Tire Pressure Adjustment** – Set for optimal cold-weather performance
- **Brake Inspection** – Pads, rotors, and fluid checked

### Visibility

- **Wiper Blade Inspection** – Checked for streaking and wear
- **Defroster Test** – Front and rear verified working
- **Washer Nozzle Adjustment** – Proper spray pattern confirmed

## Why Winter Prep Matters

| Cold Weather Challenge    | Our Solution                    |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| Hard starting             | Battery test + fresh oil        |
| Poor traction             | Tire rotation + pressure check  |
| Reduced visibility        | Wiper inspection + washer fluid |
| Longer stopping distances | Complete brake inspection       |
| Freezing coolant          | Antifreeze protection test      |

## Winter Driving Tips

After your service, keep these tips in mind:

1. **Keep your gas tank at least half full** – Prevents fuel line freeze
2. **Carry an emergency kit** – Blanket, flashlight, jumper cables
3. **Allow extra stopping distance** – Ice can appear where you least expect it
4. **Clear all snow from your vehicle** – Including the roof!
5. **Warm up your engine briefly** – 30-60 seconds is sufficient for modern vehicles

## Best Time to Schedule

We recommend getting your Winter Safety Package:

- **Late fall** – Before the first freeze
- **After storing a vehicle** – If it sat unused during summer
- **Before long winter trips** – Holiday travel preparation

_Don't get caught in the cold. Schedule your Winter Safety Package before temperatures drop._

## Keeping Our Fleet Moving

Managing a delivery fleet means downtime is not an option. Before we switched to Copperlane, we struggled with unpredictable repair times and vague communication from other shops.

### The Challenge

Our vans are on the road 12 hours a day. We needed a partner who understood that every hour in the shop is lost revenue. We were facing:

- Inconsistent maintenance schedules
- Unexpected breakdowns
- Slow turnaround times

### The Solution

Copperlane implemented a proactive fleet maintenance program for us. They track our mileage, schedule services during our downtime, and provide detailed health reports for each vehicle.
